node.title: 'This is the biggest one yet': Major flooding expected as heavy rain descends upon the east
node.alt: WRONG WAY GO BACK sign in front of rapidly flowing brown floodwaters
node.description: November rain records have already been smashed through Australia's west and centre — now, heavy rain and erratic storms are shifting towards northern NSW and southern Queensland.
node.content:
["November rain records have already been smashed through Australia's west and centre \u2014\u00a0now the focus is moving east.", "\"This is going to be the most widespread and heavy rainfall event we've seen so far heading into summer,\" according to Bureau of Meteorology senior meteorologist Jonathan How.", "And with it will come a plunge in temperatures, with\u00a0Canberra expecting a maximum temperature of just 12C on the weekend.\u00a0", "Today's\u00a0focus is on northern New South Wales and southern Queensland, with heavy rain\u00a0expected to result\u00a0in flash and riverine flooding, while erratic thunderstorms are expected to be in the mix.", "Heavy rain\u00a0is also expected in South Australia, where a low pressure system is expected to deepen.\u00a0", "Mr How\u00a0is\u00a0paying particular attention to this low, which is expected to be the focus of the rain, wind and storms over the next few days.\u00a0", "", "
Heavy rainfall is expected for large areas until Friday.(ABC News)
", "The low is expected to\u00a0move through South Australia and western New South Wales tomorrow before diving down\u00a0towards the ACT,\u00a0eastern Victoria and south-east New South Wales late Thursday and into Friday. \u00a0", "\"We are expecting the heaviest rain and winds to be quite tightly bounded to that low pressure system,\" Mr How said.\u00a0", "Easterly winds from this system could spell trouble for Victoria, where gusts from this uncommon direction have caused havoc in the past.\u00a0", "
It's also going to be freezing\u00a0
", "Conditions are expected to ease over Queensland and northern NSW on Friday and\u00a0into Saturday, but the cold\u00a0wet conditions are expected to linger down south over the weekend.\u00a0", "\"We're seeing maximum temperatures all through central and eastern Australia over the next few days between six to 16 degrees below average for this time of year,\" Mr How said.\u00a0", "He predicts some places could see their coolest November days on record, particularly around South Australia.\u00a0", "", "
It has been a broody day in Kempton, Tasmania.(Supplied: Adam Apple)
", "Canberra is expecting a maximum temperature of just 12C on Saturday and Sunday;\u00a0Melbourne is only forecast\u00a0to reach 15C over the weekend.\u00a0", "It has been snowing in Tasmania, where more falls are expected down to 500 metres over the weekend, when Victoria can also see snow down to 900 metres as another cold front comes through.\u00a0", "", "
The low near the centre of the continent is expected to deepen over the coming days.(Supplied: BOM)
", "
The flooding has started
", "More than 340mm hit\u00a0the gauge at Samuel Hill, just north of Rockhampton, in the 24 hours to 9am today, with widespread falls in the region above\u00a050mm.\u00a0", "The southern Northern Territory\u00a0has also seen phenomenal rain; Alice Springs recorded 100.2mm to 9am and the\u00a0usually dry Todd River is a raging brown torrent.\u00a0", "Less than a fortnight in, and the region has already broken its November rainfall record.\u00a0", "Earlier today a\u00a0man was rescued from the Todd River after clinging to a tree for six-and-a-half hours after\u00a0his car was swept off a causeway.", "Over in the west, it has also been wet with many long-standing November rainfall records falling.", "Coorow picked up a November record with 50mm, while\u00a0Perth metro recorded up to 40mm in a storm yesterday.", "
Heed those warnings\u00a0
", "Few parts of the country will avoid some sort\u00a0of rain over the coming days and warnings will be coming in thick and fast.\u00a0", "Keep up with your local warnings via ABC Emergency and heed the advice of the\u00a0emergency services.\u00a0", "As always, be careful around flood waters."]
